column39: In his book Our America: Nativism********** Modernism and Pluralism (1995)********** Walter Benn Michaels argues that modernism and nativism emerged together in American literature in the 1920s through their mutual commitment to resolve the meaning of identity – linguistic********** national********** cultural and racial (2-3).     Thus nativism depends on understanding one’s Americanness as racial difference as evidenced in texts by modernist writers as diverse as Willa Cather********** William Faulkner and William Carlos Williams.
